G2919.def: to come to a conclusion in the process of thinking and thus to be in a position to make a decision{N:001}

G1161.def: a marker of an additive relation, but with the possible implication of some contrast

G2919.def: to come to a conclusion in the process of thinking and thus to be in a position to make a decision{N:001}

G5259.def: a position below another position or object

G3588.def: a reference to an entity, event, or state, clearly identified by the linguistic or non-linguistic context of the utterance{N:001}

G2962.def: (a title for God and for Christ) one who exercises supernatural authority over mankind (see also {D:37.51})

G3811.def: to provide instruction, with the intent of forming proper habits of behavior{N:001}

G2443.def: a marker of purpose for events and states (sometimes occurring in highly elliptical contexts){N:001}

G2632.def: to judge someone as definitely guilty and thus subject to punishment{N:001}

G4862.def: a marker of an associative relation, often involving joint participation in some activity{N:001}

G2889.def: the universe as an ordered structure

G5620.def: a marker of result, often in contexts implying an intended or indirect purpose{N:001}

G80.def: a male having the same father (and, usually, mother) as the reference person

G4905.def: the movement of two or more objects to the same location{N:001}

G3588.def: a reference to an entity, event, or state, clearly identified by the linguistic or non-linguistic context of the utterance{N:001}

G5315.def: to consume food, usually solids, but also liquids{N:001}

G1551.def: to remain in a place and/or state, with expectancy concerning a future event{N:001}

G1487.def: a marker of a condition, real or hypothetical, actual or contrary to fact

G5100.def: a reference to someone or something indefinite, spoken or written about

G3983.def: to be in a state of hunger, without any implications of particular contributing circumstances

G1722.def: a position defined as being within certain limits{N:001}

G3624.def: a building consisting of one or more rooms and normally serving as a dwelling place (οἶκος[a] also includes certain public buildings, for example, a temple. The extension of οἶκος[a] to include temples may be the result of speaking of a temple as the dwelling place of the deity.)

G5613.def: a relatively weak marker of a relationship between events or states{N:001}

G302.def: (in combination with a past tense, as part of the apodosis of a conditional sentence) pertaining to being certain, in view of particular circumstances of a condition contrary to fact{N:001}

G2064.def: to move from one place to another, either coming or going{N:001}

G1299.def: to give detailed instructions as to what must be done{N:001}
